titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Proclamation by the Governor
CWG0865

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Proclamations, 1863-1865

body.p:
Proclamation by the Governor
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Executive Department

Whereas The President and Cashier of the Commerical Bank of Ky have certified to me that the stockholders of said Bank at a ^regular^ meeting held at their Banking House in Paducah on the 4th day of May 1865, by resolutions unanimously adopted, accepted the provisions of the act of the General Assembly, "An act for the benefit of the Incorporated Banks of Issue of Kentucky," approved 22nd February 1865 as an amendment of the Charter of said Bank,

Now, therefore, I. Thomas E. Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, in pursuance of the provisions of Section 6 of said act, do proclaim and make known that the Commerical Bank of Kentucky has ceased to be a Bank of Issue for the period of three years from and after the 16th day of May 1865, and that after ninety days from this date the Notes and Bills of the Commercial Bank of Ky shall no longer circulate as money or currency.

In Testimony Whereof I have hereunto set
my hand, and caused the seal of the Commonwealth to be affixed. Done at Frankfort this the 16th day of May AD 1865. and in the 73rd year of the Commonwealth.

Thos E Bramlette
By the Governor
E. L. VanWinkle
Secty of State

By
Jas R. Page
Asst Secty
Publish 10 days & send bill to Bank for collection
